thread.title: Wintry conditions continue to hit Scotland amid two Met Office weather warnings
thread.title_full: Wintry conditions continue to hit Scotland amid two Met Office weather warnings

author: Beth Franklin
title: Wintry conditions continue to hit Scotland amid two Met Office weather warnings
text:
News / Scotland
Wintry conditions continue to hit Scotland as temperatures plummet The Met Office issued two yellow warnings for parts of Scotland on Friday, both of which expire at 10am.
iStock Forecasters warned that snow showers are expected, with snowfall of up to 7cm likely in some places. iStock Beth Franklin Friday, January 3rd, 2025 Share this story
Facebook
X / Twitter
Copy Link
Posted in Weather Wintry conditions continue to hit Scotland as temperatures plummet, and two weather warnings for snow and ice are issued.
The Met Office issued two yellow warnings for parts of Scotland on Friday, both of which expire at 10am.
The first warning for snow and ice came into place on Thursday, covering Angus, Perth and Kinross, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands, Argyll and Bute, Shetland Islands and Orkney Islands.
Forecasters warned that snow showers are expected, with snowfall of up to 7cm likely in some places.
On higher ground, snowfall could reach up to 10cm.
The Met Office said some showers may be accompanied by strong and gusty winds leading to “temporary blizzard conditions”.
The second warning is for ice, which came into place on Thursday, covering Stirling, the Highlands, Dumfries and Galloway, as well as Strathclyde.
Forecasters said that scattered wintry showers will be replaced by a longer spell of rain and sleet on Thursday night with temperatures dip below freezing.
They added that this will lead to a risk of ice formation on untreated surfaces, especially inland.
The wintry conditions are set to continue into the weekend with an additional warning for heavy snow and ice coming into place on Saturday.
